Sentencas: Solid oxide fuel cells with Ni-yittria-stabilised zirconia (YSZ) anode supports were tested on surrogate natural gas fuels (methane containing 2.5-10% ethane and 1.25-5% propane) and compared with results for pure methane.
Titulo: Effect of Ethane and Propane in Simulated Natural Gas on the Operation of Ni-YSZ Anode Supported Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Inert anode-side diffusion barriers were found to help suppress coking on the Ni-YSZ anodes.
Titulo: Effect of Ethane and Propane in Simulated Natural Gas on the Operation of Ni-YSZ Anode Supported Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: However, carbonaceous deposits were observed on anode compartment surfaces and the barrier layers for all of the natural gas compositions tested.
Titulo: Effect of Ethane and Propane in Simulated Natural Gas on the Operation of Ni-YSZ Anode Supported Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The addition of air to the natural gas was shown to suppress this coking.
Titulo: Effect of Ethane and Propane in Simulated Natural Gas on the Operation of Ni-YSZ Anode Supported Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: For natural gas with 5% ethane and 2.5% propane, the addition of 33% air yielded stable, coke-free operation at 750 degrees C and 800 mA cm(-2).
Titulo: Effect of Ethane and Propane in Simulated Natural Gas on the Operation of Ni-YSZ Anode Supported Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Cell performance on this fuel was only slightly worse than for the same cell operated with dry hydrogen.
Titulo: Effect of Ethane and Propane in Simulated Natural Gas on the Operation of Ni-YSZ Anode Supported Solid Oxide Fuel Cells
